paragraphs.text: In the aira ecosystem, winning isn't just about being fast — it's about being smart.

Master the art of power management. Your mission is not just to reach the end, but to calculate every move so you cross the finish line just as your battery hits 0%. Your AI's success depends on these strategic decisions.

Every action must be explainable.
Make every bit of power count.

Speed is a result.
Intelligence is the strategy.

steps.title: Get the Code
steps.description: Clone the repository from GitHub to get the latest aira environment.

steps.title: Setup in Seconds

steps.title: Launch & Explore

items.title: From Manual to Autonomous
items.description: Start with simple keyboard control to understand the physics, then progress to writing your first autonomous Python scripts.

items.title: Physics-Driven Simulation

items.title: Explainability-First Design (XAI)
items.description: aira is designed to encourage explainable AI by logging images, metadata, and control signals — enabling users to analyze and justify their models' decisions.

items.title: Data-Ready for Training
items.description: Log images and metadata in a simple, transparent format, making it easy to train, debug, and iterate on AI models.

items.title: Global Leaderboards
items.description: Compare algorithm efficiency and decision quality worldwide.

items.title: Explainability Framework
items.description: A structured framework that encourages users to analyze and explain their models’ decision processes.

items.title: Dynamic Racing Environments
items.description: Races with interacting vehicles that demand anticipation, situational awareness, and collision avoidance.

items.title: Official Community Challenges
items.description: Periodic challenges designed for students, educators, and researchers.

items.question: What OS is supported?
items.answer: Currently, aira is supported on Windows 10/11. Mac and Linux support are planned for the future as the platform evolves.

items.question: Do I need advanced Python skills?
items.answer: No. You can start with very basic Python knowledge. aira encourages an exploratory style of development, where users iterate on ideas using AI coding assistants and focus on decision-making rather than syntax.

items.question: Is this for beginners?
items.answer: Yes. You can start with manual control and gradually transition to AI-based driving using examples and tutorials.

items.question: Do I need a GPU to get started?
items.answer: No. A GPU is not required. aira can be used with manual or simple control logic on a standard CPU-only environment. GPUs are optional and mainly useful for training more advanced AI models.

items.question: Can I use my own models (.pth)?
items.answer: Yes. PyTorch and other ML models can be loaded through your Python controller script.

items.question: Can this be used for classes or research?
items.answer: Yes. aira is designed for both individual learning and institutional education (B2Edu).
